class.name: OS
class.description: Operating System functions. OS Wraps the most common functionality to communicate with the host Operating System, such as: mouse grabbing, mouse cursors, clipboard, video mode, date and time, timers, environment variables, execution of binaries, command line, etc.

method.name: alert
method.description: Displays a modal dialog box utilizing the host OS.

method.name: can_draw
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the host OS allows drawing.

method.name: can_use_threads
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the current host platform is using multiple threads.

method.name: delay_msec
method.description: Delay executing of the current thread by given milliseconds.

method.name: delay_usec
method.description: Delay executing of the current thread by given microseconds.

method.name: dump_memory_to_file
method.description: Dumps the memory allocation ringlist to a file (only works in debug). Entry format per line: "Address - Size - Description"

method.name: dump_resources_to_file
method.description: Dumps all used resources to file (only works in debug). Entry format per line: "Resource Type : Resource Location" At the end of the file is a statistic of all used Resource Types.

method.name: execute
method.description: Execute the file at the given path, optionally blocking until it returns. Platform path resolution will take place. The resolved file must exist and be executable. Returns a process id. For example: [codeblock] var output = [] var pid = OS.execute('ls', [], true, output) [/codeblock] If you wish to access a shell built-in or perform a composite command, a platform specific shell can be invoked. For example: [codeblock] var pid = OS.execute('CMD.exe', ['/C', 'cd %TEMP% && dir'], true, output) [/codeblock]

method.name: find_scancode_from_string
method.description: Returns the scancode of the given string (e.g. "Escape")

method.name: get_cmdline_args
method.description: Returns the command line arguments passed to the engine.

method.name: get_date
method.description: Returns current date as a dictionary of keys: year, month, day, weekday, dst (daylight savings time).

method.name: get_datetime
method.description: Returns current datetime as a dictionary of keys: year, month, day, weekday, dst (daylight savings time), hour, minute, second.

method.name: get_datetime_from_unix_time
method.description: Get a dictionary of time values when given epoch time. Dictionary Time values will be a union of values from [method get_time] and [method get_date] dictionaries (with the exception of dst = day light standard time, as it cannot be determined from epoch).

method.name: get_dynamic_memory_usage
method.description: Returns the total amount of dynamic memory used (only works in debug).

method.name: get_environment
method.description: Returns an environment variable.

method.name: get_executable_path
method.description: Returns the path to the current engine executable.

method.name: get_latin_keyboard_variant
method.description: Returns the current latin keyboard variant as a String. Possible return values are: "QWERTY", "AZERTY", "QZERTY", "DVORAK", "NEO", "COLEMAK" or "ERROR".

method.name: get_locale
method.description: Returns the host OS locale.

method.name: get_model_name
method.description: Returns the model name of the current device.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Returns the name of the host OS. Possible values are: "Android", "Haiku", "iOS", "HTML5", "OSX", "Server", "Windows", "UWP", "X11".

method.name: get_power_percent_left
method.description: Returns the amount of battery left in the device as a percentage.

method.name: get_power_seconds_left
method.description: Returns the time in seconds before the device runs out of battery.

method.name: get_power_state
method.description: Returns the current state of the device regarding battery and power. See [code]POWERSTATE_*[/code] constants.

method.name: get_process_id
method.description: Returns the game process ID

method.name: get_processor_count
method.description: Returns the number of cores available in the host machine.

method.name: get_scancode_string
method.description: Returns the given scancode as a string (e.g. Return values: "Escape", "Shift+Escape").

method.name: get_screen_count
method.description: Returns the number of displays attached to the host machine.

method.name: get_screen_dpi
method.description:
Returns the dots per inch density of the specified screen.
On Android Devices, the actual screen densities are grouped into six generalized densities: ldpi - 120 dpi mdpi - 160 dpi hdpi - 240 dpi xhdpi - 320 dpi xxhdpi - 480 dpi xxxhdpi - 640 dpi

method.name: get_screen_position
method.description: Returns the position of the specified screen by index. If no screen index is provided, the current screen will be used.

method.name: get_screen_size
method.description: Returns the dimensions in pixels of the specified screen.

method.name: get_static_memory_peak_usage
method.description: Returns the max amount of static memory used (only works in debug).

method.name: get_static_memory_usage
method.description: Returns the amount of static memory being used by the program in bytes.

method.name: get_system_dir
method.description: Returns the actual path to commonly used folders across different platforms. Available locations are specified in [OS.SystemDir].

method.name: get_system_time_secs
method.description: Returns the epoch time of the operating system in seconds.

method.name: get_ticks_msec
method.description: Returns the amount of time passed in milliseconds since the engine started.

method.name: get_time
method.description: Returns current time as a dictionary of keys: hour, minute, second.

method.name: get_time_zone_info
method.description: Returns the current time zone as a dictionary with the keys: bias and name.

method.name: get_unique_id
method.description: Returns a string that is unique to the device. Returns empty string on HTML5 and UWP which are not supported yet.

method.name: get_unix_time
method.description: Return the current unix timestamp.

method.name: get_unix_time_from_datetime
method.description: Get an epoch time value from a dictionary of time values. [code]datetime[/code] must be populated with the following keys: year, month, day, hour, minute, second. You can pass the output from [method get_datetime_from_unix_time] directly into this function. Daylight savings time (dst), if present, is ignored.

method.name: get_user_data_dir
method.description: Returns the absolute directory path where user data is written ([code]user://[/code]).

method.name: has_environment
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if an environment variable exists.

method.name: has_touchscreen_ui_hint
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the device has a touchscreen or emulates one.

method.name: has_virtual_keyboard
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the platform has a virtual keyboard, [code]false[/code] otherwise.

method.name: hide_virtual_keyboard
method.description: Hides the virtual keyboard if it is shown, does nothing otherwise.

method.name: is_debug_build
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the build is a debug build. Returns [code]true[/code] when running in the editor. Returns [code]false[/code] if the build is a release build.

method.name: is_ok_left_and_cancel_right
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the "Okay" button should appear on the left and "Cancel" on the right.

method.name: is_scancode_unicode
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the input code has a unicode character.

method.name: is_stdout_verbose
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the engine was executed with -v (verbose stdout).

method.name: is_userfs_persistent
method.description: If [code]true[/code], the [code]user://[/code] file system is persistent, so that its state is the same after a player quits and starts the game again. Relevant to the HTML5 platform, where this persistence may be unavailable.

method.name: kill
method.description: Kill a process ID (this method can be used to kill processes that were not spawned by the game).

method.name: native_video_is_playing
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if native video is playing.

method.name: native_video_pause
method.description: Pauses native video playback.

method.name: native_video_play
method.description: Plays native video from the specified path, at the given volume and with audio and subtitle tracks.

method.name: native_video_stop
method.description: Stops native video playback.

method.name: native_video_unpause
method.description: Resumes native video playback.

method.name: print_all_resources
method.description: Shows all resources in the game. Optionally the list can be written to a file.

method.name: print_all_textures_by_size
method.description: Shows the list of loaded textures sorted by size in memory.

method.name: print_resources_by_type
method.description: Shows the number of resources loaded by the game of the given types.

method.name: print_resources_in_use
method.description: Shows all resources currently used by the game.

method.name: request_attention
method.description: Request the user attention to the window. It'll flash the taskbar button on Windows or bounce the dock icon on OSX.

method.name: set_icon
method.description: Sets the game's icon.

method.name: set_thread_name
method.description: Sets the name of the current thread.

method.name: set_use_file_access_save_and_swap
method.description: Enables backup saves if [code]enabled[/code] is [code]true[/code].

method.name: set_window_title
method.description: Sets the window title to the specified string.

method.name: shell_open
method.description: Requests the OS to open a resource with the most appropriate program. For example. [code]OS.shell_open("C:\\Users\name\Downloads")[/code] on Windows opens the file explorer at the downloads folders of the user. [code]OS.shell_open("http://godotengine.org")[/code] opens the default web browser on the official Godot website.

method.name: show_virtual_keyboard
method.description: Shows the virtual keyboard if the platform has one. The [i]existing_text[/i] parameter is useful for implementing your own LineEdit, as it tells the virtual keyboard what text has already been typed (the virtual keyboard uses it for auto-correct and predictions).

If [code]true[/code], the window is resizable by the user.
The size of the window (without counting window manager decorations).
